underlying.translation[0].note_box[0].se: Stress is the underlying cause of many illnesses.
There is an underlying assumption that new technology is always a good thing.
Their actions, he argued, went against the underlying principles of Christian morality.
Little is being done to correct the system's underlying problems.
Death and rebirth are underlying themes in all of his novels.
The underlying message of his speech was that the economic good times are over.
underlying.translation[1].definitions[0]: a rate or figure that shows the real level of inflation, EARNINGS etc although it is not immediately obvious
The underlying rate of interest went up last month.
underlying.translation[1].definitions[1]: the investment to which a DERIVATIVE such as an OPTION (=the right to buy or sell particular shares etc during a particular period of time) relates
If the warrant is held for its full 18-month life, the value of the underlying shares would have to rise at least 18.6% to make it profitable for holders.
